image.altText: Man with dark skin and hair leans over water pipe as a stream of clear water flows out over his hands.

items.synopsis: A United Nations report warns the world is "perilously close" to triggering tipping points that could have "irreversible, catastrophic impacts for people and the planet" — but it's not too late to act.

title.children: 'Irreversible, catastrophic impacts': UN warns humanity must act now to survive

image.altText: Cy, Phil Walsh composite image custom

items.synopsis: The son who killed his father, former Adelaide Crows coach Phil Walsh, has had his freedoms revoked from the state's forensic mental health facility.

title.children: Cy Walsh ordered to return to detention following concerns over mental stability

image.altText: Two cctv photos of a man holding a gun inside banks.

items.synopsis: A Supreme Court hears more details into the alleged 'bicycle bandit' case – as a prosecutor seeks the reversal of a magistrate's decision to grant the accused man home detention bail.

title.children: Bullets, robbery planning documents found at home of alleged 'bicycle bandit', SA court hears

image.altText: The Australian Aboriginal flag tied to a fence as part of a protest.

items.synopsis: Kaurna community members opposed to the way in which Aboriginal ancestral remains are being handled at a government-backed housing project in Adelaide's north call on the developer to grant refunds to homebuyers.

title.children: Homebuyers at site of Aboriginal ancestral remains should be refunded, advocates say

image.altText: A burnt fence.

items.synopsis: While police do not believe separate fires near two Adelaide mosques in the past week are linked, the Islamic Society of SA says the incidents are "not just a coincidence".

title.children: Police to increase patrols at places of worship after fires near Adelaide mosques

image.altText: Frances Chapman washes a cup at her sink.

items.synopsis: Consumer prices rose 1.2 per cent in the September quarter, slightly above economist forecasts and increasing the risks of another Reserve Bank interest rate rise.

title.children: 'Pretty scary': Rising prices and another interest rate rise might force Frances to sell her family home

image.altText: A black and white class photo with a male teacher. The children's faces are blurred.

items.synopsis: David Ernest Keith MacGregor remained a Victorian Education Department employee for seven years despite being convicted of two counts of indecent assault, an ABC Investigation can reveal.

title.children: Ex-primary teacher kept education department job for seven years after child abuse conviction

image.altText: Amir Maimon looks down on the Press Club stage.

items.synopsis: The Israeli ambassador to Australia tells the National Press Club his country remains compliant with international law in its ongoing war with Hamas.

title.children: 'Not about the numbers': Israel ambassador says his country is the victim, not the aggressor

image.altText: a little boy sits on a hospital bed crying while a doctor treats him

items.synopsis: Doctors and aid workers make sacrifices as vital supplies including medicine, food, water and fuel are days away from running out.

title.children: What Gaza urgently needs to care for civilians amid the ongoing war with Israel

image.altText: A football team celebrating a premiership win.

items.synopsis: After an earlier recommendation was widely rejected, a new proposal to restructure football in South East SA has been put forward.

title.children: A new league is coming for South East SA football as major restructure planned for 2025

image.altText: A bald man wearing a suit and floral shirt standing outside a sandstone wall

items.synopsis: A Millicent man appears in court for the first time after being charged over an incident at the office of a federal MP in the lead-up to the Voice to Parliament referendum.

title.children: Man accused of disorderly behaviour in No campaigning MP's office says he was confused

image.altText: Britney spears postes holding two awards statues shaped like astronauts

items.synopsis: It's release day for pop star Britney Spears's memoir The Woman in Me. Here's what she wants you to know about her career, the conservatorship and her relationships.

title.children: 'I am Britney Spears now': The chilling words from the father of Britney Spears and other takeaways

image.altText: A two-storey health centre in suburban Adelaide.

items.synopsis: The South Australian doctors' union says women seeking pregnancy terminations will continue to be consulted in a mouldy and dilapidated building for up to three months.

title.children: Consults to continue in 'dilapidated' Adelaide pregnancy clinic for months

image.altText: A woman stands outside a wooden house.

items.synopsis: A scheme to buyback or elevate thousands of flood-damaged homes in northern NSW is mired in delays and confusion, says locals.

title.children: How one perplexing map is driving a wedge between flood survivors

image.altText: A rundown home with a collapsed balcony floor stands in full sun in Palmerston.

items.synopsis: Darwin builder George Milatos has been ordered to pay millions of dollars to a group of property owners caught up in a controversial NT government-backed affordable housing scheme.

title.children: 'I'm actually officially on the pension': Builder says he can't pay $2.5m compensation over defected homes

image.altText: Police officer and police car on a Kirribilli street cordoned off by tape

items.synopsis: A man in his 30s sustained a minor leg wound after a shooting near the prime minister's Sydney residence, Kirribilli House.

title.children: Man injured in gangland shooting on Sydney's lower north shore

image.altText: two police officers stand next to a police car talking. crime scene tape can be seen in the foreground

items.synopsis: A 40-year-old man is being treated for life-threatening injuries after he was shot by police south of Brisbane.

title.children: Man treated for life-threatening injuries after being shot by police

image.altText: Black and white composite of missing man Donald Gordon Buckley

items.synopsis: Donald Gordon Buckley was reported missing earlier this year, and would be in his mid-90s if still alive, police said.

title.children: Police are looking for a man last seen in 1953 after 'unusual' missing person report lodged 70 years later

image.altText: a cloud of red smoke as fire burns through the night

items.synopsis: Five homes and five sheds are destroyed in multiple bushfires burning in sparsely populated bushland near Tara and further south near Millmerran, and authorities expect more will be lost.

title.children: Queensland bushfires claim a life as conditions worsen and evacuation center forced to move

image.altText: A red R-F-S fire truck in front of burning trees.

items.synopsis: Sweltering temperatures and windy conditions have flared two existing bushfires to an elevated threat level. Residents in some areas have been advised to seek shelter, and a major highway has been closed.

title.children: Fire closes New England Highway while 'problematic' blaze near Grafton escalates as NSW faces another day of fire danger

image.altText: A detective speaks to media

items.synopsis: Cameron Blaine, one of the police officers who rescued Cleo Smith in 2021, resigns from WA Police ahead of a Corruption and Crime Commission report being tabled in parliament.

title.children: High-profile cop who rescued Cleo Smith resigns from force ahead of misconduct allegations in CCC report

image.altText: A group of women in yellow soccer shirts celebrate wildly.

items.synopsis: Matildas coach Tony Gustavsson has cautioned Australian soccer fans who want to see a full-strength Sam Kerr at the Matildas' Olympic qualifiers in Perth not to expect too much from the star.

title.children: Matildas coach sounds note of caution on Sam Kerr as Matildas prepare for sold-out Perth games

image.altText: David Warner and Mitch Marsh celebrate

items.synopsis: Back-to-back wins have moved Australia into the top four, and Pat Cummins's side will be looking to keep the winning feeling against the Netherlands. Check out the live scores and stats in our ScoreCentre.

title.children: World Cup live: Australia looks to keep up momentum in Netherlands clash

image.altText: A carving in stone that looks like a face.

items.synopsis: Record low water levels along a section of the Amazon River uncover human faces sculptured into stone up to 2,000 years ago.

title.children: Drought exposes ancient rock carvings along Amazon River

image.altText: A man in sunglasses stands before a large boat on a sunny day

items.synopsis: A Queensland superyacht owner no longer stands accused of unlawfully killing a Brazilian scuba diver, but has pleaded guilty to smuggling him into Australia.

title.children: Manslaughter charge withdrawn as yachtsman pleads guilty to drug, people smuggling over deadly cocaine haul

image.altText: Woman with hazel eye and dark hair with sungalsses on head smiles at camera

items.synopsis: A land and air search is continuing in Kakadu National Park to find 35-year-old Jessica Louise Stephens, who police say travelled to the park on October 19.

title.children: Mother of woman missing in Kakadu 'holding out hope' daughter will be found

image.altText: Toddlers Saige, Ashlynn and Isaac sitting next to each other smiling

items.synopsis: A four-year-old boy dies following a shed fire in Geelong on Sunday which killed two of his siblings. A fourth sibling remains in a critical condition in hospital.

title.children: Third child dies after Geelong shed fire, 6yo girl still in critical condition

image.altText: A person in an orange fire suit spraying a hose walking through burnt bushland

items.synopsis: Authorities work to establish whether any valuable flora in Perth's Kings Park has been lost after a number of blazes ripped through it yesterday, which police believe were deliberately lit.

title.children: Firefighters probe yet another fire in Kings Park as bushland devastation revealed in stark images

image.altText: A composite image of three people

items.synopsis: The man charged with manslaughter over the fatal boat crash that killed both his wife and the mother of West Coast Eagles player Rhett Bazzo pleads not guilty to the crime.

title.children: Alleged skipper in Mandurah boat crash that killed Kylie Bazzo and Debbie Burdon denies manslaughter

image.altText: A woman sitting outside on a sunny day, in front of greenery, and tilting her head.

items.synopsis: The Justice Legislation Amendment (Domestic and Family Violence) Bill  contains a suite of changes, including reforms aimed at reducing the risk of victims being misidentified as perpetrators.

title.children: Advocates welcome proposed NT DV reforms, but say they mean 'absolutely nothing' without more funding

image.altText: Albanese, Haydon stand with Joe and Jill Biden in front of White House

items.synopsis: Anthony Albanese and his partner will be treated to an exquisite meal when they sit down as guests of honour at a White House state dinner tomorrow, but the event has been significantly toned down in light of the Israel-Gaza war.

title.children: Star-studded guest list and a five-star menu: Here's what we know about Albanese's state dinner

image.altText: A man near a door looking at the camera

items.synopsis: The West Bank doesn't usually get a mention in conversations about the world's hottest property markets, but this home is sought after for specific reasons.

title.children: Mohammed says he's been offered $100m for his home. This is why he'll never leave

image.altText: composite of a man's mugshot and a woman smiling holding a corgi

items.synopsis: Authorities say Connor Bowman tried to stop the autopsy on his wife — arguing she should be cremated immediately and claiming she had a rare illness, which hospital tests did not confirm.

title.children: Poison specialist charged with poisoning his wife after allegedly trying to stop autopsy

image.altText: A large crowd gathered outside the Opera House

items.synopsis: Documents produced in parliament yesterday revealed senior NSW police held concerns a pro-Palestinian protest at the Opera House earlier in the month could "escalate current tensions".

title.children: 'I made an error': NSW premier responds to senior police concerns over Sydney Opera House protest

image.altText: Western Sydney Wanderers' Talia Younis dribbles the football in an A-League Women game.

items.synopsis: Talia Younis was not born when the W-League was founded, but she has just broken Sam Kerr's record as the youngest player in the A-Leagues.

title.children: After breaking Sam Kerr's record, the A-Leagues' youngest-ever player has her eyes on a bright future
